alert.note: Alert for Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 4:13PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Prince Edward, central Lunenburg and southwestern Nottoway Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 413 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Green Bay, or 7 miles northwest of Victoria, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Victoria, Kenbridge, Lunenburg, Green Bay, Loves Mill, Nutbush, Scholfield, The Falls, Lafoon Corner, Meherrin, Oral Oaks, Oliveville, Rubermount and Arvins Store. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for south central and central Virginia.
